Pros: they will never fire you even you can't do your job
Cons: I don't have any cons but I can give pros: once you get in, you will retire at same rate. Even if you die they will pay you salary for few years at same rate that you got in.

Pros: Diverse generations makes the work surroundings alive. Offers high paid salaries for IT technical roles
Cons: Offers low salaries on back end services job roles like Finance, Admin and the like.

Pros: Easy work and very busy
Cons: Work life balance was not present

Pros: getting know more people with influence
Cons: sometimes bureaucracy but you can manage it

Pros: easy to learn new technical skill.
Cons: under pay in hong kong.

Pros: all dimensions development for staff. good benefits and working environment
Cons: long working hours and rush projects with limited budget and resources.

Pros: There really aren't any unless you are fresh out of highschool just needing something quick.  A lot of the people I loved working with in hindsight!
Cons: Bed bugs & fleas!  They treat the performance coaches and mission control like crap.   There has been so much leadership leave lately because it's mismanaged and who wants to deal with bed bugs In a mediocre paying job??  Insurance is horrible!   Almost certain it has went down hill since August of last year.   Basically all they do is stress management out and makes them unhappy.  Thus why most have left the job.  You can't put in a two week notice they will find a reason to get rid of you sooner if you do!!!

Pros: If you are looking for a company that makes you part of a family PCCW is where to go. They really take the time out to help you grow within the company. No worries thinking you don't have enough experiences. They work side by side with you to make you successful. Everyone makes mistakes but in their eyes it's just room for improvement and they make sure to guide you down the right path.  When I first started working for PCCW Teleservices, I was just trying to find a job until I finish with school. But now PCCW is my career. :)
Cons: Every company has cons but nothing to complain about.

Pros:
Flexible - if you're willing to voice your need, you can get flexibility from management
Scheduling - you may be hired into a less desirable shift but there are opportunities to move up
Time Off - although paid time off is not accrued until 6 months, you have the ability to take time off
Advancement - for entry level employees, advancement up the chain can happen if you are hardworking and knowledgeable
Cons:
Overworked - those in management positions are spread thin
Response Time - because of the limited resources getting what you need can take time
Development - you have to work hard to get any development time to move up or development for your job

Review Title: Not a stable, fair or consistent company
Pros: Benefits are decent. The hourly rate is between 10-15.00 but no raise.  If you just want a decent job w minimal physical activity, it is a decent job.
Cons: My training experience did not prepare for every aspect of taking calls. There is no room for growth or promotion or raises. Attendance is ridiculous you are docked by the minute.  Lots of favoritism. No focus  good customer service and management has no idea what agents experience on calls.  Hours are unstable.

Pros: Excellent working environment. Our supervisors always managed to create a fun working environment. Sales can be stressful. So, they always set up a game to be played based on the sales that we made throughout our shift. I was able to switch my schedule around based on my schedule from my other job. I was able to go to school while working here as well.
Cons: The place had many layoffs, even though I was never laid off. I was still stressed out about possibly being laid off.

Review Title: Worse company ever. Backstabbing favoritism underpaid poor upper management no communication.
Pros: Meet new people who will also be underpaid and treated poorly
Cons: Expects u to drop your everything and work on site several hours over your shift without being paid because no one will help you with your workload even though it was meant for three people. Worse pay in the Industry. Horrid benefits.  Health insurance a joke eliminated 401k. Drama like working in a high school.  Only benefits you if you are friends with upper management because everything us based on what click you belong to.

Pros: They have a fantastic staff with a positive attitude.  Im currently employed with PCCW and I can honestly say its been one of the most amazing experiences in my.  They provided proper training and treat everyone fair.
Cons: I literally cannot think of any cons being employed with PCCW.

Pros: Great culture, real family atmosphere, management tries to be as flexible as possible in personal situations. Opportunity for advancement and you don't have to wait years like most companies for it to happen. Your hard work is noticed and does pay off.
Cons: No cons, maybe more parking. If you come to work and do your best, there isn't anything to complain about.

Pros:
You get a set schedule
Coworkers are friendly
In a nicer part of town
Nice computers with fast connection 
Lots of opportunities to move to a different position
Cons:
Unorganized 
Low pay
Feels as though you can be replaced at anytime. 
Leadership finds reasons for why you're not eligible to move up within the company. 
Leadership chooses favorites

Pros: The company has a lot of company events like cookouts, ice cream socials, etc. The CEO and his wife are nice people.
Cons: Has bed bugs! No one actually does any of the things they say they'll do. Hired over 400 people for peek season but had no clue what to do to make space for parking. No where to sit, everyday was a struggle to simply get into your systems. 3 microwaves and 4 restrooms with over 400 people on one project. Do the math. Half of management has no clue what they're talking about.

Pros: Casual environment. The company lets you were jeans, sneakers . Tattoos are welcome. They have contests to make you want to do overtime .
Cons: Unprofessional . Managed by 20 somethings who were promoted because of meeting metrics, but lack leadership skills. A lot of managers chatting inappropriate conversations on the floor and seem irritated when you ask for help. Not a good place if you want to learn  skills and professionalism from management.  The workplace is a mess, dirty and you have to fight for a computer to work at.

Pros: Great basic job for students or people with something preventing them from getting other jobs. Straightforward script reading and responding.
Cons: Strict attendance requirements, even for illness or emergencies. No room for advancement, and no commission on sales. Poor instruction from management on technique.

Pros: Working in this environment can be stressful.  Other representative give a lot of motivation and encouragement when you are having a bad day.
Cons: No drug testing to be employed.  Past illegal behavior at times ignored.   Administration dismiss negative behaviors reported repeatedly by representatives on the phone regarding supervisors.

Pros:
The people you get to work with.
The fast paced environment
Cons:
The politics
The person that took control of the office I was located in ran it into the ground.
No appreciation for work done well.
Alot of non paying out of bonuses earned

Pros: I liked the people I worked with.
Cons: It was dark and dirty in the call center. Management was aloof when you had personal issues. It was all about the job. Customers were very rude. They think you work directly for the client, and expect to talk to the CEO when they don't get their way. They don't seem to realize you are the low man on the totem pole and have no say in the way the business runs. They pay peanuts.

Pros: The money was good, especially since I was making hourly plus commission. Everyone was really laid back and got along with each other.
Cons: People are rude to telemarketers and you have to follow a script.Most of the adults that worked there were immature. Almost everyone smoked and did drugs and were very unprofessional.
